creator: turbout@info.unicaen.fr
text:
mod_webapp.c is compiled 
mod_webapp.lo exists

but the Link error is :

Linking Apache 1.3 WebApp Module
/home/www/webapp/jakarta-tomcat-connectors/webapp/apr/libtool: mod_webapp.lo:
command not found
Are you able to build with the sources associated with Tomcat 4.0 beta 7?
creator: pier@betaversion.org
turbout@info.unicaen.fr
text:
when i try to compile the new webapp-module-1.0-tc40b7 or cvs one
this is already the same error
 
>Compiling Apache 1.3 WebApp module
>Linking Apache 1.3 WebApp Module
>/home/www/webapp-module-1.0-tc40b7/apr/libtool: mod_webapp.lo: command not found

creator: pier@betaversion.org
text: This bug has been fixed in CVS...

creator: turbout@info.unicaen.fr
text:
already the same problem with cvs (2001-09-05 : today) 

>Compiling sources in /home/www/jakarta-tomcat-connectors/webapp/apache-1.3...
>make[1]: Entering directory
>`/home/www/jakarta-tomcat-connectors/webapp/apache-1.3'
>Linking Apache 1.3 WebApp Module
>/home/www/jakarta-tomcat-connectors/webapp/apr/libtool: mod_webapp.lo: command
>not found
>make[1]: *** [mod_webapp.so] Error 127


I've found another bug.

Impossible to find APR source tree in webapp even when using
--with-apr=path/to/apr. same thing without --with-apr, {SRCDIR}/apr doesn't work
as SRCDIR apparently not fixed

adding variable APRDIR with good path in configure permit to go on


>if ${TEST} -z "${APA}" -a -z "${APRDIR}" ; then
>  APRDIR="{SRCDIR}/apr"
>else
>  APRDIR="${APXS_PREFIX}"
>fi
>APRDIR="/home/www/jakarta-tomcat-connectors/webapp/apr"
